textboxes.description: One evening, you sit down at your desk, determined to finally learn C++. You open your laptop, pull up a beginner's guide, and stare at the blank code editor. 'Alright, let's do this,' you mutter to yourself.

You start by writing a simple 'Hello, World!' program. It seems easy enough. The guide explains each line, but it feels a bit overwhelming as you try to understand what '#include <iostream>' and 'std::cout' actually mean.

choices.text: Take a break and watch a video explanation

textboxes.description: You find a video explaining the basics of C++, and it breaks down each part of the code step by step. Slowly, it begins to make sense. You feel a bit more confident to try coding on your own again.
Returning to the code, you start writing basic arithmetic operations. However, you hit an error and feel frustrated. The error message is cryptic: 'error: expected ';' before '}' token'.
You carefully go over each line, and finally, you find the missing semicolon. Placing it in the right spot, you run the code again. This time, it works! You feel a small victory.

choices.text: Celebrate and move on to the next lesson

textboxes.description: You read about common errors, and one of them is missing semicolons. Sure enough, you check your code and find a missing semicolon. Fixing it, you run the program again, and it works!

Feeling confident, you decide to take on a more challenging project: a simple calculator program. This involves creating functions and using variables. You type out the first few lines, but soon realize that functions are trickier than they seemed.

choices.text: Take a break and review the basics again

textboxes.description: You manage to create basic addition and subtraction functions, but you're still confused about how to handle inputs and outputs. The concepts feel a bit abstract.
After several attempts, you finally get the functions to work correctly. The calculator adds and subtracts as expected! It’s basic, but you’ve created a real program from scratch.

choices.text: End the lesson on a high note

textboxes.description: You post a question in a programming forum, and someone responds with helpful advice. Using their tips, you manage to fix your calculator program. It works perfectly now!
You save your work and close the laptop, feeling both tired and satisfied. C++ was challenging, but you’ve made progress. Maybe, just maybe, you can tackle even bigger coding projects in the future.
